intro: Ctenium villosum, commonly known as velvet ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy, often silvery foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Ctenium villosum is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
